graph_title: Net direct investment in countries receiving Official Development Assistance, and as a proportion of GDP
indicator_name: Additional financial resources mobilized for developing countries from multiple sources

sources.organisation: Ministry of Economy, Trade and Business

indicador_disponible: Net Official Development Assistance from regional and local public administrations, and in proportion to GDP
objetivo_global: 17- Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
meta_global: 17.3 Mobilize additional financial resources for developing countries from multiple sources
definicion: Proportion of net financial resources allocated to participate in the capital of companies  in countries receiving Official Development Assistance with respect to GDP at current prices  and its total value.
formula:
$$PPIBIDN_{AOD}^{t} = \frac{IDN_{AOD}^{t}}{PIB^{t}} \cdot 100$$

where: 

$IDN_{AOD}^{t} =$ net direct investment in countries receiving Official Development Assistance in year $t$ 

$PIB^{t} =$ gross domestic product at current prices in year $t$
observaciones: The Development Assistance Committee (DAC) of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)  establishes the list of countries eligible to receive Official Development Assistance. These are low- and  middle-income countries based on gross national income per capita as published by the World Bank, with the  exception of G8 members, EU members, and countries with a firm EU entry date.
texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
justificacion_global:
The indicator measures additional financial resources for developing countries from multiple sources. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
dato_global: Foreign direct investment (FDI) inflows (millions of United States dollars) GF_FRN_FDI UNSTATS
comparabilidad: The available indicator partially complies with the United Nations metadata.

es.indicador_disponible: Net Official Development Assistance from regional and local public administrations, and in proportion to GDP
es.objetivo_global: 17- Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
es.meta_global: 17.3 Mobilize additional financial resources for developing countries from multiple sources
es.definicion: Proporción que representan los recursos financieros netos destinados a participar en el capital de  las empresas de los países receptores de Ayuda oficial al desarrollo respecto al PIB a  precios corrientes y su valor total.
es.formula:
$$PPIBIDN_{AOD}^{t} = \frac{IDN_{AOD}^{t}}{PIB^{t}} \cdot 100$$

donde: 

$IDN_{AOD}^{t} =$ inversión directa neta en los países receptores de Ayuda oficial al desarrollo en el año $t$ 

$PIB^{t} =$ producto interior bruto a precios corrientes en el año $t$
es.observaciones: El Comité de Ayuda al Desarrollo (CAD) de la Organización para la Cooperación y el  Desarrollo Económicos (OCDE) establece la lista de países elegibles para recibir Ayuda  Oficial al Desarrollo. Se trata de los países de ingresos bajos y medianos en base  al ingreso nacional bruto per cápita publicado por el Banco Mundial, con la excepción  de los miembros del G8, miembros de la UE y países con fecha firme para entrar en la UE.
es.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
es.justificacion_global:
El indicador mide los recursos financieros adicionales para los países en 
desarrollo provenientes de múltiples fuentes. 

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
es.dato_global: Entradas de inversión extranjera directa (IED) (millones de dólares estadounidenses) GF_FRN_FDI UNSTATS
es.comparabilidad: El indicador disponible cumple parcialmente con los metadatos de Naciones Unidas.
